seisflows.tools.graphics module¶

seisflows.tools.graphics.get_regular_ticks(v, interval)[source]¶

Returns regular tick intervals.

seisflows.tools.graphics.plot_gll(x, y, z, vmin=None, vmax=None)[source]¶

Plots values on 2D unstructured GLL mesh

seisflows.tools.graphics.plot_many_gll(x, y, z, vmin=None, vmax=None)[source]¶

Plots values on big 2D unstructured GLL mesh (in that case tricontourf does not work)

seisflows.tools.graphics.plot_section(stream, ax=None, cmap='seismic', clip=100, title='', x_interval=1.0, y_interval=1.0)[source]¶

Plots a seismic section from an obspy stream.

Parameters:
  • stream (Obspy stream object) – Obspy stream object created from a SU data file
  • ax (Matplotlib Axes object) – Optional axis object
  • cmap (str) – Matplotlib colormap option.
  • clip (float) – Percentage value (0-100) for amplitude clipping
  • title (str) – plot title
  • x_interval (float) – Offset axis tick interval in km
  • y_interval (float) – Time axis tick interval in km
Raises:

NotImplementedError – If stream object does not have SU format
seisflows.tools.graphics.plot_vector(t, v, xlabel='', ylabel='', title='')[source]¶

Plots a vector or time series.

Parameters:
  • v (ndarray, ndims = 1/2) – Vector or time series to plot
  • xlabel (str) – x axis label
  • ylabel (str) – y axis label
  • title (str) – plot title
Raises:

ValueError – If dimensions of v are greater than 2

seisflows.tools.seismic module¶

class seisflows.tools.seismic.Container[source]¶

Bases: collections.defaultdict

Dictionary-like object for holding models or kernels

class seisflows.tools.seismic.Minmax[source]¶

Bases: collections.defaultdict

Keeps track of min,max values of model or kernel

update([E, ]**F) → None. Update D from dict/iterable E and F.[source]¶

If E present and has a .keys() method, does: for k in E: D[k] = E[k] If E present and lacks .keys() method, does: for (k, v) in E: D[k] = v In either case, this is followed by: for k in F: D[k] = F[k]

class seisflows.tools.seismic.Writer(path='./output.stat')[source]¶

Bases: object

Utility for appending values to text files

seisflows.tools.seismic.call_solver(mpiexec, executable, output='solver.log')[source]¶

Calls MPI solver executable

A less complicated version, without error catching, would be subprocess.call(mpiexec +’ ‘+ executable, shell=True)

seisflows.tools.signal module¶

seisflows.tools.signal.correlate(u, v)[source]¶
seisflows.tools.signal.mask(slope, const, offset, time_scheme, length=400)[source]¶

Constructs tapered mask that can be applied to trace to mute early or late arrivals.

seisflows.tools.signal.mute_early_arrivals(traces, slope, const, time_scheme, s_coords, r_coords)[source]¶

Applies tapered mask to record section, muting early arrivals

Signals arriving before

SLOPE * || s - r || + CONST

are muted, where slope is has units of velocity**-1, CONST has units of time, and || s - r || is distance between source and receiver.

seisflows.tools.signal.mute_late_arrivals(traces, slope, const, time_scheme, s_coords, r_coords)[source]¶

Applies tapered mask to record section, muting late arrivals

Signals arriving after

SLOPE * || s - r || + CONST

are muted, where SLOPE is has units of velocity**-1, CONST has units of time, and || s - r || is distance between source and receiver.

seisflows.tools.signal.mute_long_offsets(traces, dist, s_coords, r_coords)[source]¶

Mutes traces having

|| s - r || > DIST

where || s - r || is the offset between source and receiver and DIST is a user-supplied cutoff

seisflows.tools.signal.mute_short_offsets(traces, dist, s_coords, r_coords)[source]¶

Mutes traces having

|| s - r || < DIST

where || s - r || is the offset between source and receiver and DIST is a user-supplied cutoff

seisflows.tools.signal.sconvolve(s, h, w, inplace=True)[source]¶
seisflows.tools.signal.tukeywin(nt, imin, imax, alpha=0.05)[source]¶
